Genes List

A Table of Named Genes within the HLA Region

Gene Previous Equivalent Description Function Refs
A - Class I α-chain Presents peptide antigens to the immune system A Refs
B - Class I α-chain Involved in immune response by presenting intracellular antigens B Refs
C - Class I α-chain Presents peptides derived from intracellular proteins to cytotoxic T cells C Refs
E E, 6.2 Class I α-chain associated with class I 6.2-kB Hind III fragment Modulates the activity of natural killer cells E Refs
F F, 5.4 Class I α-chain associated with class I 5.4-kB Hind III fragment Plays a role in immune response and presenting antigenic peptides F Refs
G G, 6.0 Class I α-chain associated with class I 6.0-kB Hind III fragment Important for immune tolerance during pregnancy G Refs
H H, AR, 12.4 Class I pseudogene associated with 5.4-kB Hind III fragment Presents peptides to the immune system and modulates immune responses H Refs
J cda12 Class I pseudogene associated with 5.9-kB Hind III fragment Contributes to immune system function by presenting peptides to T cells J Refs
K HLA-70 Class I pseudogene associated with 7.0-kB Hind III fragment Participates in the presentation of antigens to the immune system K Refs
L HLA-92 Class I pseudogene associated with 9.2-kB Hind III fragment Plays a role in immune system regulation L Refs
N HLA-30 Class I gene fragment associated with a 1.7-kB Hind III fragment Contributes to the immune response through antigen presentation N Refs
P HLA-90 Class I gene fragment associated with 9.0-kB Hind III fragment Involved in the modulation of immune responses P Refs
R HLA-OLI Class I gene fragment Associated with immune system function and antigen presentation R Refs
S HLA-17 Class I gene fragment associated with a 3.0-kB Hind III fragment Contributes to the presentation of intracellular antigens S Refs
T HLA-16 Class I gene fragment associated with 16.0-kB Hind III fragment Plays a role in the immune system's response to pathogens T Refs
U HLA-21 Class I gene fragment associated with 2.1-kB Hind III fragment Involved in the modulation of immune responses U Refs
V HLA-75 Class I gene fragment associated with 7.5-kB Hind III fragment Plays a role in immune system function V Refs
W HLA-80 Class I gene fragment associated with 8.0-kB Hind III fragment Associated with antigen processing and presentation W Refs
X HLA-X Class I gene fragment Contributes to immune system function X Refs
Y HLA-BEL/COQ/DEL Class I pseudogene Participates in immune regulation Y Refs
Z HLA-Z1 Class I gene fragment located within the HLA Class II region Involved in antigen presentation to the immune system Z Refs
DRA DRα DR α-chain Involved in the presentation of peptides to T cells DRA Refs
DRB1 DRβI, DR1B DR β1-chain determining specificities DR1, DR2, DR3, DR4, DR5 etc Plays a critical role in presenting antigens to helper T cells DRB1 Refs
DRB2 DRβII Pseudogene with DR β-like sequences Non-functional gene related to immune response DRB2 Refs
DRB3 DRβIII, DR3B DR β3-chain determining DR52 and Dw24, Dw25, Dw26 specificities Involved in antigen presentation and immune response DRB3 Refs
DRB4 DRβIV, DR4B DR β4-chain determining DR53 Plays a role in presenting antigens to T cells DRB4 Refs
DRB5 DRβIII DR β5-chain determining DR51 Involved in immune system's ability to recognize foreign molecules DRB5 Refs
DRB6 DRBX, DRBσ DRB pseudogene found on DR1, DR2 and DR10 haplotypes Non-functional gene related to the DRB family DRB6 Refs
DRB7 DRBψ1 DRB pseudogene found on DR4, DR7 and DR9 haplotypes Non-functional gene related to the DRB family DRB7 Refs
DRB8 DRBψ2 DRB pseudogene found on DR4, DR7 and DR9 haplotypes Non-functional gene related to the DRB family DRB8 Refs
DRB9 M4.2 β exon DRB pseudogene, isolated fragment Non-functional gene fragment related to DRB DRB9 Refs
DQA1 DQα1, DQ1A DQ α-chain as expressed Involved in presenting antigens to the immune system DQA1 Refs
DQB1 DQβ1, DQ1B DQ β-chain as expressed Works with DQα to present antigens to T cells DQB1 Refs
DQA2 DXα, DQ2A DQ α-chain-related sequence Related to antigen presentation, but not as widely expressed DQA2 Refs
DQB2 DXβ, DQ2B DQ β-chain-related sequence Related to immune function and antigen presentation DQB2 Refs
DQB3 DVβ, DQB3 DQ β-chain-related sequence, not known to be expressed Potentially involved in immune response DQB3 Refs
DOA DZα, DOα, DNA DO α-chain Involved in the regulation of MHC class II expression DOA Refs
DOB DOβ DO β-chain Regulates the activity of other MHC class II molecules DOB Refs
DMA RING6 DM α-chain Involved in the processing and presentation of peptides by MHC class II DMA Refs
DMB RING7 DM β-chain Functions in peptide editing for MHC class II presentation DMB Refs
DPA1 DPα1, DP1A DP α-chain as expressed Works with DPβ to present peptides to the immune system DPA1 Refs
DPB1 DPβ1, DP1B DP β-chain as expressed Crucial for the presentation of antigens to helper T cells DPB1 Refs
DPA2 DPα2, DP2A DP α-chain-related pseudogene Related to immune response, but not expressed DPA2 Refs
DPB2 DPβ2, DP2B DP β-chain-related pseudogene Related to immune response, but not expressed DPB2 Refs
DPA3 DPA3 DP α-chain-related pseudogene Related to immune response, but not expressed DPA3 Refs
HFE High Fe Class I-like gene Regulates iron absorption in the body HFE Refs
TAP1 ABCB2, RING4, Y3, PSF1 ABC (ATP Binding Cassette) transporter Involved in peptide transport across the endoplasmic reticulum membrane TAP1 Refs
TAP2 ABCB3, RING11, Y1, PSF2 ABC (ATP Binding Cassette) transporter Works with TAP1 in antigen processing TAP2 Refs
PSMB9 LMP2, RING12 Proteasome-related sequence Involved in the degradation of proteins, essential for antigen processing PSMB9 Refs
PSMB8 LMP7, RING10 Proteasome-related sequence Crucial for the production of peptides presented by MHC class I PSMB8 Refs
MICA MICA, PERB11.1 Class I chain-related gene Involved in the activation of natural killer cells and certain T cells MICA Refs
MICB MICB, PERB11.2 Class I chain-related gene Works with MICA in immune response activation MICB Refs
MICC MICC, PERB11.3 Class I chain-related pseudogene Non-functional gene related to MICA/MICB MICC Refs
MICD MICD, PERB11.4 Class I chain-related pseudogene Non-functional gene related to MICA/MICB MICD Refs
MICE MICE, PERB11.5 Class I chain-related pseudogene Non-functional gene related to MICA/MICB MICE Refs
